channel.title: Er, coordinate thingy, confused with?

item.title: Er, coordinate thingy, confused with?
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

Chassy13:

They are like the bottom-left and top-right corners of a box. This boolean is often used in non-PKing areas. If you need help on figuring out the coordinates, just take a look at a nonWild boolean in most sources.

Ah, thanks. Never really tried doing this, so i was pretty clueless, anyways thanks:D

item.title: Er, coordinate thingy, confused with?
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

I’ve actually never tried, but I’m abit confused when doing this like for example:

public boolean test() { if(absX >= XXXX && XXXX <= 3166 && absY >= YYYY && absY <= YYYY) { return true; } else { return false; } }

What do you exactly put for the two xxxx’s, and the two yyyy’s? Thanks in advance.
